unnormalised: Hey guys, really interesting discussion on training regimens! My coach, Dr. Sharma, always emphasized a mix. We'd do strength training, like squats, and also plenty of long runs, maybe 10 km, preparing for the Mumbai marathon. Nutrition plays a big role too, just like dadi always said! And adequate rest is key, even for someone training at the SAI! What's the ideal setup for a home gym in, say, 200 sq ft in Delhi? Anyone got tips? These fancy machines cost so many Rs!
normalised: Hey guys, really interesting discussion on training regimens! My coach, Doctor Sharma, always emphasized a mix. We'd do strength training, like squats, and also plenty of long runs, maybe ten kilometer, preparing for the Mumbai marathon. Nutrition plays a big role too, just like dadi always said! And adequate rest is key, even for someone training at the S A I! What's the ideal setup for a home gym in, say, two hundred square feet in Delhi? Anyone got tips? These fancy machines cost so many rupees!
